qas.question: In what year did Muslim general Muhammad bin Qasim take over most of the Indus area?
Who eventually defeated the Arabs at Rajasthan?
In what area did the Indian Kings contain the Arabs?
When was the Arab invasion repulsed?
Where did the Arabs establish as the capital of the newly conquered territory?

context: In <a0_0>712<a0_0/>, Arab Muslim general Muhammad bin Qasim conquered most of the Indus region in modern-day Pakistan for the Umayyad Empire, incorporating it as the "As-Sindh" province with its capital at <a4_0>Al-Mansurah<a4_0/>, 72 km (45 mi) north of modern Hyderabad in Sindh, Pakistan. After several incursions, the <a1_0>Hindu kings<a1_0/> east of Indus defeated the Arabs at the Battle of Rajasthan, halting their expansion and containing them at <a2_0>Sindh in Pakistan<a2_0/>. The south Indian Chalukya empire under Vikramaditya II, Nagabhata I of the Pratihara dynasty and Bappa Rawal of the Guhilot dynasty repulsed the Arab invaders in the <a3_0>early 8th century<a3_0/>.
